intro: Scyphosyce, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, often spiny, leaf structures and showy, dandelion-like flowers. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and are adapted to saline and sandy soils. Scyphosyce species are known for their resilience to harsh maritime conditions. Their ecological role includes providing habitat for small marine organisms and contributing to coastal dune stabilization.
